Name: Santiago de Chile
Description: Santiago is the capital and economic center of Chile. With its many museums, events, theaters, restaurants, bars and other entertainment and cultural opportunities, it is also the political and cultural center of the country. Its central location in the country makes it a great base for visiting other areas, and it is possible to ski in the nearby Andes and later be on the beach in the same day.

Name: Concepción
Description: Concepción is the second largest city of Chile with a population of almost 227,000 (out of Concepción province's 946,000) as of 2016. It is on the coast of Southern Chile.

Name: Iquique
Description: Iquique is in the Northern Chile. City  home to the duty free zone called "Zofri" and a growing number of high rise resort hotels along its beaches. Slightly more expensive and polluted than neighboring population centers, such as Arica, but a convenient place to stock up on duty free perfumes and laptop computers.

Name: La Serena
Description: La Serena is a charming town in Northern Chile. There is a lot to see and do nearby.

Name: Punta Arenas
Description: Punta Arenas is the regional capital of the Magallanes y Antártica Region located in Chilean Patagonia. Punta Arenas (formerly Punta Arenosa, "Sandy Point") is located on the Brunswick Peninsula and was founded in the 17th century by Englishman J. Byron who gave it the name of Sandy Point. With a population of around 125,000 (2015), it is the largest settlement on the Strait of Magellan and is located 1418 km from the coast of Antarctica. The history and economic growth of the city is based on maritime commerce, oil extraction, and sheep breeding.

Name: San Pedro de Atacama
Description: San Pedro de Atacama is a town in Northern Chile.

Name: Valparaíso
Description: Valparaíso is a city of around 300,000 on the Pacific coast of Central Chile.  Frequently referred to as simply Valpo, it is located approximately 120 km west of the capital, Santiago de Chile.  The city is widely known for its bohemian culture, brightly colored houses, and beautiful seaside views.

Name: Vina del Mar
Description: Viña del Mar is in Central Chile and is a beach resort town close to Santiago de Chile. It's the most important beach in the country.  It plays host to a famous music festival every year in mid-February.

Name: Chiloé Island
Description: Chiloé Island (Spanish: Isla de Chiloé) is in Southern Chile, off-shore from the northern Patagonian regions of Los Lagos and Aysén.

Name: Laguna San Rafael National Park
Description: Laguna San Rafael National Park is a park on the Pacific coast of  Patagonia in Chile.

Name: Lauca National Park
Description: Lauca National Park is an 1379 km² protected area in Northern Chile. It's located in the Andean range and is characterized by volcanic mountains. It's also a good place to spot many typically Andean animals, from alpacas and llamas to flamingos and – if you're lucky – condors.

Name: Pichilemu
Description: Pichilemu [dead link] is a holiday town with beaches in Central Chile, south of Valparaíso.

Name: Robinson Crusoe Island
Description: Juan Fernández Islands is a small island archipelago off the coast of Central Chile.

Name: Torres del Paine National Park
Description: Torres del Paine is a national park in Chilean Patagonia. It is in the southern tiers of the Andes and features mountains, lakes, and glaciers.

Name: Valle de Elqui
Description: The Northern region of Chile is among the driest regions in the world.

Name: Valle de la Luna
Description: San Pedro de Atacama is a town in Northern Chile.
